Hi Joyce:

Thanks; another small piece of the family.

You could be correct with Liegh in lieu of Leith.

A WWII Draft Card might also give his middle name.

It was often a popular tradition to give a son or daughter their mother or grandmother’s nee surname as their middle name.

Dave

On 13-10-31 9:49 AM, "J Gerbrandt" <jgerbran@...> wrote:

Charles L. Lane

Rhode Island, Deaths and Burials, 1802-1950

birth: 1921

death: 23 May 1950 Manhattan, New York, New York

burial: 26 May 1950 Pawtucket, R. I.

father:Roland P. Lane

mother:Mary Leigh

spouse:Helen D. Lane

I think the D. in Helen’s name is probably for Durning.

Could Charles L. Lane be Charles Leigh Lane instead of Charles Leith Lane?

Joyce

From: Margaret Annand <mailto:margaretannand@...>

Sent: Wednesday, October 30, 2013 6:39 PM

To: nscumber@yahoogroups.com

Subject: Re: [nscumber] Obit: Lane, Helen Rose [nee Durning]

During WWII the Americans had a naval base in Lower Selmah, on Cobequid Bay in Hants County. The experimental work carried out there was secret but bombs were dropped into the Bay and retrieved when the tide went out, and taken to the laboratory for examination --or so the story went. One of the Americans was Charlie Lane, the husband of Helen Durning. Helen was a nurse at the VG Hospital in Halifax, perhaps just in training. Charlie had the use of a navy Jeep to come to Halifax to see her. I don't have his obituary as it wasn't published here to my knowledge but he died in New York, and was living in Pawtucket, R.I. at the time of his death on May 23, year unknown. His name was Charles Leith Lane.

Margaret

Lane (Durning), Helen Rose

Helen Rose (Durning) Lane, 89, of Florence, S.C., died Thursday, October 24, 2013, in McLeod Hospice House. Helen was born in Parrsboro, a daughter of the late Samuel Graham Durning and Susan Rose (McLellan) Durning. She was predeceased by her husband, Charles L. Lane; her parents; sisters, Dorothy (Bill) Hunt, Florence (LeRoy) Faulkner, Beryl (Clinton) McKay; and step-mother, Mary Florence Durning. Surviving are her brothers, Robert G. (Janine) Durning of Dartmouth; William H. (Lucie) Durning of Ottawa, Ont.; brother-in-law, LeRoy Faulkner of Economy; special friend, Grace Miner of Florence, S.C.; and a number of nieces and nephews. A Memorial Service will be held at 3 p.m. on Friday, November 1, in Stoudenmire-Dowling Funeral Home Chapel. Donations may be made to The Kidney Foundation of Canada, Nova Scotia Branch, 235 - 1657 Barrington St., Halifax, NS, B3U 2A1. Please sign the Tribute Wall for Ms. Lane at the obit section of: www.stoudenmiredowling.com

[Published in the Chronicle Herald, Wednesday, October 30, 2013]

[Collected by DAW, 30 Oct 2013]

[No mention of brother, Allan Graham Durning (1934-1957)
